result.value: This R package provides functionality for data formatting, preprocessing, filtering, exploratory data analysis and visualization of fourier transform (FT) mass spectrometry (MS) data.
Example data are available in the __ftmsRanalaysis__ package. Information about how to access this data is shown in package vignettes and on the website (link in the tutorial section above)

(**Recommended**) To install the latest *release*:
```r
devtools::install_github("EMSL-Computing/ftmsRanalysis@*release")
```

To install a specific release, say 1.0.0:

```r
devtools::install_github("EMSL-Computing/ftmsRanalysis@1.0.0")
```

**(Not recommended, since these changes are still being tested) **, You can also install the most current version of master:

```r
devtools::install_github("EMSL-Computing/ftmsRanalysis")
```

result.description:
## What's Changed
* Add all element cols by @cstrauch711  in https://github.com/EMSL-Computing/ftmsRanalysis/pull/25

Capability to specify any set of elemental columns.  Change is somewhat backwards compatible with previous versions, where CHNOSP were the only elemental columns specified.  get/set functions for those elements should still work, but object construction is changed.  See the documentation for the new `as.peakData`

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/EMSL-Computing/ftmsRanalysis/compare/1.1.0...1.2.0

### Features
Now has the ability to ingest data created using https://github.com/EMSL-Computing/CoreMS.  See the article titled "Formatting CoreMS data for ftmsRanalysis".

### Bugfixes
Fixed an error in applyFilt caused by reference to a non-existent object.
result.name: Version 1.1.0

result.description:
This is the legacy version of ftmsRanalysis and includes all changes up to [dd3bc3afbf6d1250d1f86e22b936dcc154f4101d](https://github.com/EMSL-Computing/ftmsRanalysis/commit/dd3bc3afbf6d1250d1f86e22b936dcc154f4101d).  A large overhaul is in the works which will include the following:

- Have the ability to ingest output from [Core-MS](https://github.com/EMSL-Computing/CoreMS)
- Remove uses of stale packages from delta-rho (the old trelliscope and datadr)
- Modernize the uses of Kegg and MetaCyc databases

result.value: To get started, see the package documentation and function reference located at http://EMSL-Computing.github.io/ftmsRanalysis.
